ie.dcu.cngl.summarizer.feature

Class GlobalBushyFeature

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.dcu.cngl.summarizer.feature.Feature
      • ie.dcu.cngl.summarizer.feature.LuceneFeature
        • ie.dcu.cngl.summarizer.feature.GlobalBushyFeature

  • public class GlobalBushyFeature
extends LuceneFeature
    The GlobalBushyFeature was proposed by Salton et al - "The bushiness of a node on a map is defined as the number of links connecting it to other nodes on the map. Since a highly bushy node is linked to a number of other nodes, it has an overlapping vocabulary with several paragraphs and is likely to discuss topics covered in many other paragraphs". It is used here at sentence level.
    sentence score = ∑ similarity to each other sentence
    Author:
    Shane

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • GlobalBushyFeature

        public GlobalBushyFeature()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Create GlobalBushyFeature with defaults 0.8 for minimum similarity, and 1.0 for maximum simlarity. Any similarity scores outside these boundaries will not be counted. The default minimum sentence query length is set to 20.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • setMinimumSimilarity

        public void setMinimumSimilarity(double minimumSimilarity)
        Set the minimum similarity limit. Any sentence comparisons below this level will not be counted. They are deemed to be too dissimilar.
        Parameters:
        minimumSimilarity -

      • setMaximumSimilarity

        public void setMaximumSimilarity(double maximumSimilarity)
        Set the maximum similarity limit. Any sentence comparisons above this level will not be counted. Some sentences are almost carbon copies, and will score artificially high. These high scores are not good indicators of central nodes.
        Parameters:
        minimumSimilarity -

      • setSentenceQueryMinLength

        public void setSentenceQueryMinLength(int sentenceQueryMinLength)
        Set the minimum sentence query length. To calculate the similarity of each sentence a query is provided to a lucene index containing all sentences. Sentences with few query terms score artifically high, and are not good indicators of central nodes. Increasing this value improves central node detection, as well as performance (due to a reduction in the number of queries).
        Parameters:
        sentenceQueryMinLength -
